Class Mat

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • tools.numbers.ToolNumber
        • tools.numbers.ToolNumberAdapter<Mat>
          • tools.matrix.Mat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, HashObservableInterface, ObsInterface, PublicCloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Vec
    @Deprecated
public class Mat
extends ToolNumberAdapter<Mat>
implements PublicCloneable, HashObservableInterface
    Deprecated.
    Old class, and needs to be refactored.
    Class for matrix operations.

      • Mat

        public Mat​(Mat mat_1,
           java.lang.Number fillValue_1,
           java.lang.Number fillValue_2,
           Mat mat_2)
        Deprecated.
        Creates a matrix from 2 other matrices, where the two matrices are placed such that the lower right corner of mat_1 hits the upper left corner of mat_2. The values on the right of mat_1 and the left of mat_2 are filled with resp. fillValue_1 and fillValue_2. The matrix will look like this: [[A, B] [C, D]] with A = mat_1, B = fillValue_1, C = fillValue_2, D = mat_2.
        Parameters:
        mat_1 - the upper left part matrix.
        fillValue_1 - the value to be filled for the upper right part of the matrix.
        fillValue_2 - the value to be filled for the lower left part of the matrix.
        mat_2 - the lower right part matrix.

      • Mat

        public Mat​(Mat mat_1,
           ToolNumber fillValue_1,
           ToolNumber fillValue_2,
           Mat mat_2)
        Deprecated.

        Deprecated.
        Creates a matrix object from another matrix.
        Parameters:

      • multiplyAll

        public static <M extends Mat> M multiplyAll​(Mat[] mats)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                            MatrixDimensionException
        Deprecated.
        Multiplies all matrices, assuming the order left to right. (so mat[begin] * mat[begin+1] * ... * mat[end-1]).
        Parameters:
        begin - the first index of mats that will be used in the multiplication (inclusive). Default is 0.
        end - the last index of mats that will be used in the multiplication (exclusive). default is mats.length.
        result - matrix that will contain the result of the operation. Default is null.
        mats - the matrices to be multiplied.
        Returns:
        result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - iff mats == null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - iff 0 <= begin < end <= mats.length does not hold.
        MatrixDimensionException - iff any of the matrix multiplications is not allowed due to incorrect matrix dimensions.

      • multiplyAll

        public <M extends Mat> M setMatrix​(java.lang.Number[][] num)
        Deprecated.
        Sets the values of the matrix.
        Parameters:
        num - the new values of the matrix.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - iff mat == null or any mat[i] == null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - iff mat == null || mat[i] == null.
        MatrixDimensionException - iff mat.length == 0. Converts each value of to a PrimitiveNumber. Then uses <M>setMatrix(tools.numbers.ToolNumber[][]) for setting the matrix.

      • calcCoMatrix

        public <M extends Mat> M calcCoMatrix()
        Deprecated.
        Calculates the cofactor matrix of the current matrix.
        Parameters:
        result - the matrix in which the result will be stored. Default is null. If null, the default matrix is used.
        Returns:
        the cofactor matrix.
        Throws:
        MatrixDimensionException - iff the matrix is not square. Calculation: Cof_[i, j](mat) = det(M_[mat, i, j]) * (-1)^(i+j) where: - Cof_[i, j] = cofactor at (i, j); - mat = the matrix to be calculated. - det(x) = calculate the determinant of x. - M_[m, i, j] = the minor of matrix m at (i, j).

      • calcCoMatrix

        public <M extends Mat> M calcCoMatrix​(M result)
        Deprecated.

      • calcTransCoMatrix

        public Mat calcTransCoMatrix()
        Deprecated.
        Calculates the transpose cofactor matrix of the current matrix.
        Parameters:
        result - the matrix in which the result will be stored. Default is null. If null, the default matrix is used.
        Returns:
        the cofactor matrix.
        Throws:
        MatrixDimensionException - iff the matrix is not square. For calculation, see <M>calcCoMatrix().

      • calcTransCoMatrix

      • det

        public ToolNumber det()
        Deprecated.
        Throws:
        MatrixDimensionException - iff the matrix is not square. Calculation: det(mat)[i][j] = mat[i][j] * det(M_[mat, i, j]) where: - det(m) = the determinant of matrix m. - mat = the current matrix. - M_[m, i, j] = the minor matrix at (i, j).

      • addRowToRow

        protected <M extends Mat> M addRowToRow​(int rowFrom,
                                        int rowTo,
                                        java.lang.Number scalar,
                                        boolean clone)
        Deprecated.
        Adds the values of rowFrom to rowTo.
        Parameters:
        rowFrom - the row used for adding.
        rowTo - the destination row.
        scalar - the factor which the from-row is pre-multiplied with before being added to the to-row.
        clone - denotes whether to do the operation in-place or return a clone.
        Returns:
        a matrix where the from-row was added to the to-row.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - iff rowFrom < 0 || rowFrom >= #rows || rowTo < 0 || rowTo >= #rows. Note that rowFrom and rowTo denote the indeces of the matrix.

        protected <M extends Mat> M addColToCol​(int colFrom,
                                        int colTo,
                                        java.lang.Number scalar,
                                        boolean clone)
        Deprecated.
        Adds the values of colFrom to colTo.
        Parameters:
        colFrom - the Col used for adding.
        colTo - the destination Col.

        Returns:
        a matrix where the from-col was added to the to-col.

      • mulCol

        public <M extends Mat> M mulCol​(int col,
                                java.lang.Number scalar)
        Deprecated.
        Multiplies the given col with a scalar.
        Parameters:
        col - col to multiply.
        scalar - the used scalar.
        clone - denotes whether to do the operation in-place or return a clone.
        Returns:
        a matrix where all values on the given col are multiplied with the given scalar.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - iff col < 0 || col >= #cols.

      • getValue

        Deprecated.
        ------------------------------------------------------------------------- Overrides from ToolNumber. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
        Specified by:

      • inverse

        public <T extends ToolNumber> T inverse()
        Deprecated.
        Specified by:
        inverse in class ToolNumber
        Returns:
        the inverse of this matrix. Calculation notes: Calculates the inverse by adding rows of the matrix to other rows to create the I matrix. Then do the exact same operations (in the same order) for an I matrix. This matrix will then be the result. Note that the types of the ToolNumbers used in values will be converted to Double. To prevent this from happening, use <M>inverseKeepType(). Also note that this method is ~2.4 times faster!

      • inverseKeepType

        public <M extends Mat> M inverseKeepType()
        Deprecated.
        Returns:
        the inverse of this matrix. Calculation notes: inverse(mat) = CM_[mat]^T / det(mat) where: - CM_[m] = the cofactor matrix of m. - m^T = transpose matrix of m. - det(m) = determinant of m. Note that the type of the ToolNumbers used in values will remain the same. To convert the default type to Double, use <T>inverse(). Also note that this method is ~2.4 times slower!

         throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • addTool

        protected <M extends Mat> M addTool​(ToolNumber tn1,
                                    ToolNumber tn2,
                                    M result)
                             throws MatrixDimensionException,
                                    java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Deprecated.
        Adds the first two numbers an outputs the result using the result matrix.
        Specified by:
        addTool in class ToolNumberAdapter<Mat>
        Returns:
        if result == null, tn1 + tn2. Otherwise result, where result == tn1 + tn2.
        Throws:
        MatrixDimensionException - iff o either of tn1 or tn2 is a matrix, and the other a value and the matrix has not the dimension 1x1 o both tn1 or tn2 are matrices and their number of rows and columns differ from eachother.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - iff neither tn1 as tn2 are a matrix. Also see ToolNumberAdapter#addTool(ToolNumber, ToolNumber, M).

      • subTool

        protected <M extends Mat> M subTool​(ToolNumber tn1,
                                    ToolNumber tn2,
                                    M result)
                             throws MatrixDimensionException,
                                    java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Deprecated.
        Subtracts the first number from the second number and outputs the result via the result matrix.
        Specified by:
        subTool in class ToolNumberAdapter<Mat>
        Throws:
        MatrixDimensionException - iff o either of tn1 or tn2 is a matrix, and the other a value and the matrix has not the dimension 1x1 o both tn1 or tn2 are matrices and their number of rows and columns differ from eachother.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - iff neither tn1 as tn2 are a matrix. Also see ToolNumberAdapter#subTool(ToolNumber, ToolNumber, M).

      • mulTool

        protected <M extends Mat> M mulTool​(ToolNumber tn1,
                                    ToolNumber tn2,
                                    M result)
                             throws MatrixDimensionException,
                                    java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Deprecated.
        Multiplies the first number with the second number and outputs the result via the result matrix.
        Specified by:
        mulTool in class ToolNumberAdapter<Mat>
        Returns:
        if result == null, tn1 * tn2. Otherwise result, where result == tn1 * tn2.
        Throws:
        MatrixDimensionException - iff both tn1 or tn2 are matrices and the number of columns of tn1 is not equal to the number of rows of tn2.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - iff neither tn1 as tn2 are a matrix. Also see ToolNumberAdapter#mulTool(ToolNumber, ToolNumber, M).

      • divTool

        protected <M extends Mat> M divTool​(ToolNumber tn1,
                                    ToolNumber tn2,
                                    M result)
                             throws MatrixDimensionException,
                                    java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Deprecated.
        Divides the first number by the second number and outputs the result via the result matrix. Note that if both are matrices, matrix multiplication is used, but now every first number is divided by the second number, so: tn1 * (tn2)^-1 is what actually happens (every number in tn2 is inversed)).
        Specified by:
        divTool in class ToolNumberAdapter<Mat>
        Throws:
        MatrixDimensionException - iff both tn1 or tn2 are matrices and the number of columns of tn1 is not equal to the number of rows of tn2.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - iff neither tn1 as tn2 are a matrix. Also see ToolNumberAdapter#divTool(ToolNumber, ToolNumber, M).

      • modTool

        protected <M extends Mat> M modTool​(ToolNumber tn1,
                                    ToolNumber tn2,
                                    M result)
                             throws MatrixDimensionException,
                                    java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Deprecated.
        Calculates tn1 % tn2.
        Specified by:
        modTool in class ToolNumberAdapter<Mat>
        Returns:
        if result == null, tn1 % tn2. Otherwise result, where result == tn1 % tn2.
        Throws:
        MatrixDimensionException - iff o either of tn1 or tn2 is a matrix, and the other a value and the matrix has not the dimension 1x1 o both tn1 or tn2 are matrices and their number of rows and columns differ from eachother.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - iff neither tn1 as tn2 are a matrix. Also see ToolNumberAdapter#modTool(ToolNumber, ToolNumber, M).

      • clone

        public Mat clone()
        Deprecated.
        Clones the current matrix.
        Specified by:
        clone in interface PublicCloneable
        Specified by:
        clone in class ToolNumber
        Returns:
        a clone of the matrix. Note that the returned value is a Mat, and not a M extends Mat since this is not allowed due to the existance of theObject.clone() method. However, it is allowed to cast the clone to the desired class.
        See Also:
        Object.clone()

      • matrixDimCheck

        public void matrixDimCheck​(int rows,
                           int cols)
                    throws MatrixDimensionException
        Deprecated.
        This method is called when the matrix is set via setMatrix(ToolNumber[][], boolean) and adds constrains for the dimension. A MatrixDimensionException should be thrown here if an unacceptable matrix dimension was given.
        Throws:
        MatrixDimensionException

      • createDefaultInstance

        @Deprecated
public static <M extends Mat> M createDefaultInstance()
        Deprecated.
        This method provides a default instance for the results used in the functions. Implement this function to change the returned type of each of the functions above.
        Returns:
        the default instance. Notes for implementing classes: - It is advised to return the basic instance of your class (e.g. (M) new MyMat()). - This function is used in almost every operation, so keep the runtime low, preferable O(1). - To prevent infinite recursion, do NOT use any method that might depend on this function. - For every call, a new instance should be created. So do NOT return the same (static) matrix object.
